title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: The Morrison government has announced it will establish a $1 billion fund to support new energy generation, storage, and transmission. The money will be spent by the Clean Energy Finance Corporation and is the first capital injection into the CEFC since it was established in 2012. Projects eligible for the funding include energy storage such as pumped hydro and batteries, transmission infrastructure, and technology to stabilise the energy grid. The government said the Grid Reliability Fund will prioritise projects in states where governments are working with federal counterparts on agreed reliability goals.
